title: Jupyter output for RichHandler/Logging formatted strangely
body:
Thank you for building this great package. I'm trying to see if we can use the RichHandler as our logging handler. A lot of our users use jupyter notebooks to run code.

I noticed that the formatting has a lot of spacing peculiarities in jupyter (e.g., text looks big and vertical spacing between lines is large)

I also tried setting my own Console with `force_terminal=True` and found that these lines are the likely culprit for the strange formatting

https://github.com/willmcgugan/rich/blob/a47bf8b66eebc65dc115400e018678f61f30266c/rich/console.py#L336-L339

as `force_terminal=True` has no impact here.

Another caveat is that the formatting had no color in Google Colab unless I set `force_terminal=True`. Colab has a custom config of jupyter notebooks and perhaps has a stdout console?

For reference, [this](https://github.com/YosefLab/scVI/pull/726/files) is what I had to do to get the spacing to look good in a local jupyter notebook. The result of this is good spacing, but weird colors.
